description: A wedding party is a joyous and celebratory event that typically takes place after the wedding ceremony. It is a gathering of family and friends who come together to celebrate the newlywed couple's union. The wedding party often includes a reception with food, drinks, music, and dancing.

A birthday party is a celebratory event held to mark and commemorate an individual's birthday, typically an annual occasion. It is a time for friends and family to come together and acknowledge the birthday person's special day. Birthday parties can vary widely in terms of their style, size, and activities.

An anniversary party is a special celebration held to commemorate a significant milestone in a couple's or an organization's history. These milestones often include wedding anniversaries, such as the first, tenth, 25th, or 50th wedding anniversary, or organizational anniversaries, like the founding anniversary of a company or institution.

An engagement party is a celebratory event held to mark and announce an engagement, the formal commitment of two individuals to marry. These parties are typically held shortly after the engagement, serving as a way to bring together close family and friends to share in the joy and excitement of the couple's decision to get married.

A retirement party is a special celebration held in honor of an individual who is retiring from their job or career after many years of dedicated service. These parties are typically organized by colleagues, friends, or family members to mark the retiree's transition into a new phase of life, often marked by leisure, travel, and pursuing personal interests.

A baby shower is a special celebration held to honor an expectant mother and her soon-to-arrive baby. It's typically organized by friends, family, or colleagues to provide support and best wishes to the parents-to-be. The event often takes place before the baby's birth and includes a range of fun and heartwarming activities.
